website_summaries.verdict: The Sennheiser HD 4.50 BTNC headphones deliver a powerful Bluetooth audio experience and decent noise cancellation for the price, but some performance quirks hold them back.
pros: Strong bass response matched with crisp, bright highs
Bluetooth functionality and active noise cancellation
cons: Can get uncomfortable over long listening sessions
Not for those seeking accurate sound signature

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Sennheiser 4.50 wireless headphones
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for use on holiday and long flights to and from west coast of U.S. after reviewing loads of reviews including more expensive headphones. These were great, cut out the background noise of engines, and other passengers too, and meant I could listen to podcasts and watch films, no problem. Think they're excellent value for the cost, I wore them for a number of hours with no issues, cushioning on headband and ears made them very comfortable too. Definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Stevo 68

customer_reviews.title: Ok but there are better
customer_reviews.text: Sound ok without noise cancelling but with it turned on you loose all the depth and base with the music. Sadly had to send these back for a different brand. The ear covers also make your ears sweat really bad.
customer_reviews.author: Basil1836

customer_reviews.title: Excellent noise cancelling headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for under £90 on an Amazon Treasure Truck deal and have so far not regretted my purchase. I am very picky about sound quality and these do not disappoint. Very good clarify, separation, bass and treble on many different types of music. Noise cancelling is very effective and hardly affects the sound quality at all. The headphones are light, extremely comfortable and fold up quite small. There is a basic but perfectly usable carrying case. Overall I am very happy to with these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: JNS

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, not cheap but worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic, not cheap but worth every penny; superb sound and easy functionality. No hesitation in recommending such a class product
customer_reviews.author: Howard L

customer_reviews.title: Messes with your inner ear
customer_reviews.text: Everything about these headphones are fantastic & I suspect the issue lies with me & not them, but I wore them for a trip around a shopping center to see if they were good only to discover I needed to take them off due to feeling sick & at one point vomiting on the floor. I suspect the noise cancelation messes with my inner ear that helps with balance & because of this I carried on getting dizzy & falling over myself. Everything else is fantastic but I'm just warning people that may also have this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Cain

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones, perfect for making calls
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are superb. They are comfortable to wear even for long periods of time, do a great job of noise cancellation and sound great. They are the only headphones I have used where people on the phone can hear me clearly, and they even cancel noise coming from people who are on the phone, which is very good. I had one problem with them in that when playing with certain apps, the volume controls behaved strangely, and as those apps worked perfectly well with other bluetooth devices I can only summise that the problem was with these. I'm dropping a star for that, but the problem does seem to have gone away with some software update.
customer_reviews.author: dotmit

customer_reviews.title: Best money I've spent all year
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are amazing, I bought them primarily for use with my macbook and iPhone. It was really important to me that when watching movies that there would be no lag and these headphones do not disappoint. The sound quality is fantastic, music sounds crisp and punchy, movies sound deep and rich. I couldn't be much happier with them. The only thing I would change is the colour, it's a bit boring! In a world of Beats and Sony Headphones full of colour and interesting design I think these look a little bland, but the performance more than makes up for that. I'm so happy with this purchase, easily the best money I have spent all year.
customer_reviews.author: Dave McG.

customer_reviews.title: Best
customer_reviews.text: I use it every day, movie and music, paired with my PC / Laptop or phone. Mac / Windows and Android the sound quality is top. Very good connecting it with a Mac, walking up and down the house without losing on connection quality. These were great when travel too, cut out the background noise of engines, and other passengers too, and meant I could listen to podcasts and watch films, no problem. Think they're excellent value for the cost, I wore them for a number of hours with no issues, cushioning on headband and ears made them very comfortable too. Definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Ichim

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I was really disappointed with these headphones, returned them after 2 days. They were the flattest headphones I've ever had. With the noise cancellation turned on it was even worse. The inline controls only work when the headset is powered and operating wirelessly. The built in EQ would only work with tracks played through their app, which was pretty terrible. The EQ on the Android OS wasn't compatible with them. Seriously, I have a £30 pair of SoundMagic ear buds that sound infinitly better than these.
customer_reviews.author: James Pace

customer_reviews.title: senn down hill
customer_reviews.text: if I had paid full price I would have sent them back.always had Sennheiser headphones but this is the last time.i did look at the bad reviews but as a few good ones chose to ignore the bad nes. negs. head band hurts your head buttons to fiddly instructions useless wired lead difficult to get in and smaller size to usual one so expensive to replace I expect noise cancellation not very good sound very bassy lucky I have good eq to turn bass down cheap feel small thing....voice says 'ower on ower off'?p for poor pos: good sound comfy around ears value for money ok wish I had spent the extra on bose but 3x price
customer_reviews.author: PLUMBO

customer_reviews.title: Great cheaper alternative to it's competitors
customer_reviews.text: Brought these for my father, he tells me they are some of the most comfortable headphones he has worn. He mentioned that the noise cancellation though good is not as good as other options on the market such as the Bose QC35's though it is still very good. He finds them very comfy to wear due to the soft earcups and headband and the battery life is perfect on them. The major downfall of these headphones is the sound quality, he finds them a little too bass heavy and would much prefer a more neutral sound stage.
customer_reviews.author: ReviewClu

customer_reviews.title: There is a specific way to wear these headphones
customer_reviews.text: In order to experience 100% of the sound from these very very good quality headphones you have to place them a certain way on your ears. As you realise once you purchase these headphones, the ear cups are really small and look embarrassing; however if you slightly crumple your wider, flimsy part of your ear into the cup so that all the ear fits in the cup, you are wearing it appropriately. This allows your to experience the actual ANC aswell as the high sound quality which other reviewers do not experience as they place the headphones ontop of their ears ( the ANC is much more pronounced when worn this way).
customer_reviews.author: net2ts

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Decent noise cancellers at a good price point. Apparently these are the 4.50 BTNC's ugly sisters. Same inside but just black plastic, no fancy finish. Noise cancellation is noticeable when they power on. Once you're listening to music, you can loose track of your surroundings. The sound quality is good. These could be as good as it gets at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: John Watts

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancellation does a poor job, but otherwise good headphones
customer_reviews.text: I bought these on offer, so I'm overall very pleased with them. The noise cancellation is very weak, it cancels only background noise, so if someone is speaking near you, you can pretty well hear them. The Bluetooth connectivity was alright, they always say they're disconnected even if they are, but they work so that's alright in the end. The sound quality is on point, what I'd expect. They are also pretty comfortable to wear, especially on the top of my head, where I typically get pain after many hours - well, not with these. My ears fit alright under, but if someone has bigger ears, they might not find them as comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Alina T

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones 🎧 👍
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones, I bought them on Black Friday so got quite a good deal. The sound quality is fantastic (Listen to Dark side of them! 😎). I have only had to charge them twice in the month since I have had them but I don’t use them every day. The noise cancelling is good but not as good Bose headphones I have tried, they still cope well with indescript background noise (such as engine noise). I can’t really comment on durability at this point but they seem well made. They are also very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: James M Bancroft

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic headphones. Sound quality is great, you cannot hear a thing when you're wearing it, connects straight away and requires no drivers or setup. The mic quality is average, it's acceptable but really, it's not great. You will also feel your face or ears getting a little hot after long usage sessions. Not much air can escape and therefore you do heat up. This isn't a problem for me as I usually take them off for a few minutes break every hour or two during long sessions anyway but if you do plan on wearing them for 4-5 hours you should expect to take them off for a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Happy Sennheiser customer
customer_reviews.text: I’ve spent a year researching ANC headphones....For years I’ve been a fan of Sennheiser but could never afford a pair... Wellll! Thanks to trusty Amazon, my wish was granted. Despite the negative reviews, these headphones are the bomb. Yes! This is a real review!!! My only gripe is that they really suck onto your ears which can get a bit uncomfortable....overall the acoustics are phenomenal... I love a lot of bass!!! I’m a happy camper!!! Oh and I was able to get it for a great price. £84.99!!!!🥳🎉🥳 The day after my purchase, the price shot back up to £148.99.... Thanks Amazon!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. R. Hawthorne

customer_reviews.title: good value, decent sound, but not comfortable enough
customer_reviews.text: These are good value noise cancelling wireless phones with many of the usual Sennheiser qualities: solid construction, a decent (online) user manual, and good sonic performance without being exciting. Noise cancelling is ok on trains and planes: but if you're on a long haul flight, or listening to a Wagner opera in a single take (or indeed both) I wouldn't recommend them. They are too heavy, and prolonged use is bad for the neck. And if you are planning to use them for regular commutes (if such a thing exists nowadays) you will need to buy a sturdier case than the one supplied.
customer_reviews.author: Camberwick Green is Puppets

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headphones
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy listening to music through these headphones, the sound has depth and quality. They also block out all the background noise that can sometimes affect your enjoyment.
customer_reviews.author: G M Davies

customer_reviews.title: Not noise cancelling but good sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Whilst the design is quite cool nice Matt black , there is literally little to none soundproof. When activated I could still hear very loudly people around me in the office and on the street 2/10 Because I wear glasses after like 45min of wearing the headsets this also becomes a major inconvenience as it’s pressing on the frames so not ideal for people who wear glasses and want to use the headphones for long journeys train plain etc 4/10 Music quality is good 8/10 Battery life is decent will last you a whole day almost off on and off usage 9/10 Not a good value for money unless you’re just buying it for the brand 2/10
customer_reviews.author: Victor N. Rusu

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre at best
customer_reviews.text: I would love to have reported positively about these headphones, as my first furray into semi expensive headphones, but I have to say I was disappointed with these. The depth of sound (the base I suppose) just isn’t there. And they are quite big and uncomfortable to wear. I actually prefer to use by lightweight JVC headphones costing £5.99. I know this isn’t everyone’s experience judging by the reviews. I would say the £160ish price tag just isn’t justified or realistic. I suspect that people only buy these in half price sales, when they think they’re getting a bargain for the famous brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bruce Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Everything about these headphones is okay but not amazing from the noise cancellation to the sound quality. You can't expect too much from an entry level price point to nosie cancelling though. The buttons on the right side are really useful when I go walking and want to skip back and forward on an audiobook, or pause because a loud car is about to go past. They're reasonably comfortable but I sometimes find my ears pressing into the plastic in the middle of the speakers. Their battery life is excellent but the LOUD low battery reminder is very unpleasant as well as the loud 'connected' confirmation. Decent enough but nothing to rave about really.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality sound but sub par construction
customer_reviews.text: I cannot fault the quality of the sound or the noise cancelling features of these headphones, however I am very disappointed with the quality of ear muffs themselves. I haven't even had these headphones a whole year and yet the ear muffs are already falling apart. A seam has split and is growing wider, meaning you can see the inner foam, disfiguring the muff as a whole and as such reducing sound quality. For the price of these you would expect them to last a bit longer. They're not even heavily used as I use them primarily on my PC.
customer_reviews.author: Lynnette

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish!  A Huge disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I finally made the step & bought these Sennheiser headphones. What a terrible mistake. The bluetooth connection is painful, and when they finally did connect they crashed my pc .. see attached pic. I cannot review sound quality, volume control or noise cancellation because this product fails to connect. The App provided is no longer supported Utter rubbish, Sennheiser should be very embarrased at marketing such a poor product. The build quality is poor, the documentaion is rubbish. Any £40 heaphone is better than these. I've lost my job thanks to Covid19 & this was intended to be a special treat .. they are a total waste of money. Not happy
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Roskrow

customer_reviews.title: Best quality headphones I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: What can I say... I bought these to replace my Corsair Vengance 1500 (dated but sound quality is still 100% my mic started to buzz I put it down to age of the wires). I chose to go with an XLR mic and thus these paired up perfectly. The sound is like being at a cinima. The fit to my head is snug and the pads use memory foam so my ears don't hurt after long hours of use. They can be wired or wireless. Box says up to 25hrs battery, I manged 21 until they died. There is not much else I can say except for under £100 I doubt you will find a better headphone.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Issue with beeping. Returned product.
customer_reviews.text: The beeping issue is unreal. You have to lower the volume to the minimum then you can ONLY use the headphones to adjust the volume. If you don’t do that, every time you swap applications you get a beep. Every time a song changes you get a beep. Every time a video so much as loops you get a beep (now imagine that on a 6 second looped video... BEEP BEEP BEEP BEEP BEEP). Going to return these to amazon on Monday. It’s a shame as sennheiser have always been my go to when it comes to sound.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Dull, flat and lifeless sound. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: From Sennheiser headphones I was expecting really rich vibrant sound, but the sound from these is incredibly dull, flat and lifeless. Noise cancelling is pretty effective, but when activated unfortunately you lose even more bass and depth from the sound. Very disappointing - I wish I had saved my money and bought a £30 pair of headphones - paying massively over the odds for the Sennheiser name just wasn’t worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Tea Drinker

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant performance at a great price. Glad I didn't spend anothe £150 on Bose!
customer_reviews.text: Can't fault these headphones. Great performance, (18 hz to 22 khz). Noise cancellation works well. Good battery life. Easy to pair on Bluetooth. The optional mini jack lead is a bonus. I doubt I will ever need it, but is a nice touch, as is the carry case provided. The phones fold down to a nice size, and are quite compact in the case. Ears get a bit warm after 2 or 3 hours, but that applies to all closed cup full sized headphones. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DEADHEAD

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Being my first ever noise cancellation headphones I have mixed feelings, yes theu are great when you travel and it does get a bit less noisy but by no means do they make it go all silent, I am happy with them but I have nothing to compare them with, would have enjoyed a bit more volume,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy them for noice cancellation.
customer_reviews.text: Decent sound, complicated controls, earpads cause the ears to sweat within 10-15 minutes of use. Just used it for a day to commute to work in the tube and the noise cancellation was useless, could not hear a word of what was spoken on my regular netflix shows unless I crank the volume to the max. My 20£ in ear earphones have better sound isolation. Had to return my pair.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver P.

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably good, you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Pros: These are pretty solid for the price. The sound quality is pretty good, and they are nicely constructed. The range is excellent. Cons: The multiple connected devices feature doesn't work, don't even try. You often have to disconnect and reconnect, or turn the headphones off and on, or it will complain about being disconnected long after one device was disconnected but the other was not. The controls are fiddly. Does not support AptX
customer_reviews.author: Joel Hutton

customer_reviews.title: Truly Awful - Avoid
customer_reviews.text: These are awful headphones. The sound quality is ok at best. Nothing better than the next pair of BT cans. On full charge, I get choppy sound when near other BT headphones, or in train stations. Interference is a huge problem. They're comfortable and light enough to ware for a few hours but they're ugly. Square head ugly. They really stick out. The accessories and bag - cheap and nasty.
customer_reviews.author: Luke WB Murray

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones, comfortable, etc
customer_reviews.text: Yea these are good headphones they have good reviews all over the internet. I dont use the bluetooth side to them as i always use them wired. I found the volume was much lower on bluetooth whereas with a cable its loud like it should be. Sound quality wise there good, not as bassy as i had hoped, iv had in ear headphones much bassier but the comfort for extended use makes up for that. Overall highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Scouser86

customer_reviews.title: terrible sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Considering the price, and generally positive reviews all over the internet, I expected great sound, but the sound is tinny, unclear, distant, has no base, and lacks detail & richness. It sounds like I'm playing the music out my phone's speaker, or those cheap aeroplane headphones they give you to watch movies (especially after owning a pair of Beats headphones for years, which now sound godly in comparison). The fact that my old apple earphones sound considerably better than these, apparently, 'top of the range' headphones (for their price) is laughable. I'll be returning them as soon as I get the chance.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Beep Beep
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is good for the price, crisp top end and tight bass. Noise cancellation works but is not in the Bose league, but then of course these are half the price. The real problem is the beeps!!! Turn up the volume beeb!!! turn down the volume beep!!! turn it up and down a few notches a few beeps!!!! Sometimes a beep between songs! Come on sennheiser sort this out with a firmware upgrade. There are a few temporary work arounds but no cure.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant headphones! They look great, are comfortable, they sound brilliant and I love the noise cancelling feature. I honestly wish I had bought these earlier, it makes communting to work much more appealing. The handsfree is decent too. The only down side (although it doesn't bother me at all) is that your ears become hot after extended wear as there is little ventilation. Overall, I would highly recommend these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: M. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for money and great quality
customer_reviews.text: I have had Bluetooth headphones before and these are by far my favourite. Some others have mentioned that they get a bit toasty around the ears, in the winter this is wonderful... Not sure about the summer yet. The sound quality isn't like £300 headphones but then again they are not £300 headphones so hard to fault them in that but as it's not the tip top I marked it down a touch. Connectivity and control is fine for me, intuitive and easy to use. If you get them on special you will not be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Danny Lovell

customer_reviews.title: Solid headphones with great design and features
customer_reviews.text: I have used sennheiser headphones for years and this one delivers in many aspects, excellent battery life, foldable for storage, noise cancellation is excellent, the headphone design is also aesthetically pleasing, all around great purchase. My one gripe is the sound quality while good, is not the same as in previous sennheiser headphones. It’s not terrible or anything, and I only notice it when listening to bass-heavy rock music. For most classical/soundtrack or other instrumental music, including lo-fi/beats it sounds great. Also works nicely for spoken audio/podcasts.
customer_reviews.author: Samiz

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't hear a car crash!
customer_reviews.text: Picture this. I'm in my kitchen (approx 20m from road), reheating yesterday's carbonara, listening to some bangers on these headphones. I walk upstairs, hot carbonara in hand, look out the window and I've just missed a 70mph smash from a drunk lad in a fiesta and a parked Clio (He was fine, miraculously). I heard NONE of this with my music on 65% volume! Noise cancelling 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy H

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and long battery life. What more do you want?
customer_reviews.text: These are great! Best headphones I’ve bought for myself for sound quality and they’re the first pair of noise cancelling headphones that I’ve bought, I’ll never go back! The battery life is really good on them. I listen to them on the commute to work (40mins per day) and the odd time out for a walk, and one charge normally lasts me the whole week. I do wear glasses so listening to them for more than two hours at a time they start to get a little uncomfortable, but I blame my stupid eyes. Would recommend if you’re looking to invest in a more higher quality set of headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, sturdy and sounds great!
customer_reviews.text: Headphones are comfortable - plenty of padding and a decent amount of adjustment available (length and cup rotation). Sound quality is great, noise cancelling works well and found it easy to connect via bluetooth once I read the quick start guide!! Activate bluetooth search mode by pressing and holding the power button for 5+ seconds until the led flashes red & blue. Once connection is established they connect quite quickly every time. Overall build quality is good and the headphones feel quite sturdy. Packaging is a plain brown box (great!!) and contains a carry bag for the headphones (when folded) and also holds the included wires (charge and sound). So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. C. BYRNE

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value for money compared to others available. The sound quality is excellent, I don't have the bass up particularly high, but it sounds fine. The noise cancellation is amazing, ANC means you can still hear certain things like the doorbell or a screaming child, but softens background noise. I wear mine at the gym and I can't hear any of the other music. Also, the function buttons on the headphones make them really easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Rich B.

customer_reviews.title: almost perfect - some niggles
customer_reviews.text: sound quality, for me, is perfect, but I'm no accoustics expert. They hide airplane and train noise very well while still allowing you to hear what the person next to you is saying. But the carry case is soft and poor quality, the controls on the ear to switch on and off =, jump tracks, connect to Bluetooth etc is massivley fiddly.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Superb headphones, woeful instructions
customer_reviews.text: These came in very plain packaging, appear to be an Amazon special edition. Headphones are typically superb Sennheiser audio quality, build quality is excellent so far. Headphone jack needs a very firm push to engage into the headphone socket if not using wirelessly via Bluetooth. The only thing that lets the overall experience down is the woeful set of instructions included - do yourself a favour and download the pdf of the full instructions from the Sennheiser website - you'll then be able to actually work out properly what all the features are!
customer_reviews.author: Sini-books

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, just works, excellent customer support from manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, folds up easily into the provided soft case, just works faultlessly every time. Case includes pocket for the charge cable. Instructions included and available as a pdf from Sennheiser's website. Have contacted Sennheiser previously by e-mail about a problem with another product and received the best customer care ever, so great backup, just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Murray

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones - but only for people with small ears
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and the noise cancelling works really well. Possibly a bit too much though as they amplify you footsteps as a loud thud which makes them impossible to wear while walking. Comfort wise though there's a huge problem; these can only be considered "over ear" if you have the head of a small child or teeny-tiny ears. They really sit firmly ON the ear and the pads get sweaty very quickly. Sit still, only wear them for less than an hour at a time and they sound great though.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: They are Sennheiser, so guaranteed to be very good
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son, who loves them. Excellent noise cancelling, very well made, excellent adjustment to fit and superb sound reproduction. Battery life is perfectly OK for normal day to day life and the charge time is only 2 hours. Not as much bass as my momentum's, but still very rewarding sound.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great-sounding headphones, but not the most comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking and clearly well-made headphones with balanced audio and what so far appears to be good battery life. However, they aren't the most comfortable headphones, particularly if you have a large head like me - the earpads and headband are both a little tight on the head, requiring a good deal of readjustment when using for extended periods. But I would still highly recommend them, especially if you can get them in a sale (got mine for half price on Black Friday - bargain!)
customer_reviews.author: O. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable basic noise cancelling headphones
customer_reviews.text: Had the earphones for about 5 months, they are not bad earphones for commuting, which is why I bought them. The noise cancellation is OK, not the best. They are quite comfortable, but on a hot day can get a bit warm, as they are closed backs. The volume rocker on mine is a weakness. The volume down button is a bit sticky and can lead to zero volume if you tilt the headphones down. But it is an intermittent problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing purchase - poor cancelling. Which? magazine Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I've usually been pleased with Sennheiser products that these headphones have been a disappointment. They were described as noise cancelling but the feature is barely effective. Sound quality and comfort are fine. Subsequently I discovered that this product has been rated as a Don't Buy by Which? magazine. Overall a huge disappointment because I specifically wanted the noise cancelling.
customer_reviews.author: Olp1e

customer_reviews.title: Excellent noise cancelling and sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Amazing headphones. Excellent noise cancelling for the busy high street, the train station and the train commute. Very comfortable to wear for a couple of hours. I brought these instead of the £300+ Bose QC35 and it's so worth it. The extra £40 for noise cancelling on the same pair was so worth it.
customer_reviews.author: mr u.

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser Quality
customer_reviews.text: I use these phones to listen to mostly Spotify on my iPhone. Sound quality is first rate. They are really comfortable to wear for extended periods and the ears do not get hot either which is unusual. You can forget you have these phones on your head! They are nice and light so no headaches after using. The only thing that can be annoying is the clicks from the phone are transmitted into the sound. But this could well be an iPhone setting. Battery life is really good after only 2 hours charging. Overall I’m very impressed with these. I like Sennheiser products they are well designed and engineered.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Haywood

customer_reviews.title: Nowhere as comfortable as Bose
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a second pair to a Bose headset. Sound fine and but nowhere near as comfortable. Why is it that only Bose seems to get that right? Returning and ordering a second pair of Bose (the cheaper no-NC one as I already have the NC one). The Bose are so comfortable you actually enjoy wearing them, whereas these feel uncomfortable within minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great...Just great...
customer_reviews.text: Product has great sounds however they could be a little louder. I can sit and have it on full volume and be fine. But...A big but is that when i started to wapa round around i could hear and feel it rattling that sounds like my footsteps but also happens when i move my head fast. So i would not recommend these for running. The headphones feel great on my ears but they are quite small, i have average to small ears but my ears have to took into them. For these reasons i give them a 3
customer_reviews.author: dylan

customer_reviews.title: Battery life excellent
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace a long serving set of Bose ae2w cans. For the price they are amazing. I like the style of noise cancelling, which is less ‘complete’ than the Bose style but feels a bit safer in a public space. The sound quality is excellent and they are relatively comfortable, perhaps not quite as comfortable as the Bose set (much bigger pads) but still perfectly good for my max 90 minute commute. Battery life is excellent
customer_reviews.author: DarrenG

customer_reviews.title: Hurts my ears
customer_reviews.text: This is a purchase I really wish I could have back. I bought Sennheiser out of brand loyalty. But for the first time, this headset gives me really annoying ear pain after about an hour of use. Otherwise, I have no complaints. I'm not blown away by the noise cancellation or sound quality. But they're just fine. I just prefer to listen to music in comfort rather than pain.
customer_reviews.author: deanosrs

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser HD 4.50 Special Edition
customer_reviews.text: Classic Sennheiser quality, sound is very balanced and clear. Good sound stage too. The noise cancelling is very good, once it's on and audio (podcast, music, film) is flowing it's very difficult to hear any outside noise. It takes a little time to get used to the fit and find the sweet spot, not probably apt to big ears. I haven't been able to test the battery extensively yet as I only had it for a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: superb
customer_reviews.text: I use these travelling to work in the mornings and they are great at keeping the noise out of my world. I can sit and listen in peace without being disturbed by outside noise. Great quality, love them!
customer_reviews.author: jacx

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser after sale service was excellent
customer_reviews.text: I take my hat off to sennheiser. I had an issue where my right headphone died during use and was frustrated as it was under a year since I'd bought the product. That being said, I sent it off for repair Saturday and recieved a brand new pair in the post 4 days later. Really prompt emails, super slick process, cannot fault it. Kept me a fan of the brand for sure as that's super important if something does go wrong. As for the headphones they're very comfortable, sound great and the noise cancellation is really noticeable when you turn them on
customer_reviews.author: KrisKross

customer_reviews.title: Moderate NC, Good n Balanced Sound - Great value for money
customer_reviews.text: Its the same experience as I read in Internet and watched in review videos. - moderate noise cancellation .. still good at this price bracket. - sound is balanced, low freq side is full n rich, mid n high are controlled yet clear. Its nice sound. - material quality nice. - battery life lasts for 3 days with moderate n mix use (appx 22 hrs with NC on and off)
customer_reviews.author: Akash Mandal

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality from these headphones is... alright, honestly I didn't have them on long enough to test this. The headphones are incredibly tight to the point they were giving me a headache, had to take them off after less than a few minutes. If you have a smaller head you might be OK, but this felt like somebody was pressing in with a vice on me.
customer_reviews.author: A. N. Eades

customer_reviews.title: Not for everyone
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed. I should have returned them for a refund, but things got in the way. They are uncomfortable. Unless your head fits exactly, then they are unpleasant to wear. If you wear them for making phone calls as I do, then forget it, as the sound quality is terrible. An expensive mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Very nice headphones.
customer_reviews.text: These were a Christmas present for my daughter and she absolutely loves, really good value for the price. FYI I purchased these on a Black Friday deal with a very large saving, I cannot comment on how good the quality is if you compare it to the standard price. They are very good though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lowest volume setting an issue but great otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the commute due to comfortable, powerful, clear sound but listening in bed at low levels is almost impossible as they are too loud. Also almost as bulky when folded and the bag/case is horrible. Noise cancelling is quite subtle but general insulation from outside noise is good as standard. App (graphic EQ) is interesting but a bit of a gimmick. Also had a pair of Lindy BNX-60 which are the opposite in every respect - gave them to my daughter as not powerful enough for subway/underground commute.
customer_reviews.author: D H

customer_reviews.title: Great value if you get them at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Got these in a Black Friday sale, and love them a lot. Plenty of bass, but not Beats levels of excess. They do become a little uncomfortable when wearing glasses (as do many over-ear headphones, and a friend with ear piercings also reported problems.
customer_reviews.author: Solublepeter

customer_reviews.title: May have been unlucky.
customer_reviews.text: I was using these every day while commuting and things started off well. The NC wasn't perfect but certainly helped deaden day to day noise, and overall the sound quality was good. They were not comfortable for longer journeys, which may be deal-breaker for some. I was prepared to put up with that, but unfortunately after a few weeks the frame started creaking which was extremely distracting when walking and particularly bad if I needed to adjust the volume or pause the audio (the controls being on the right cup), so have returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Defective first pair, second pair ok.
customer_reviews.text: First pair started refusing to connect after about a month. Had to send them back, the second pair has been faultless for about a year. The noise cancellation isn't as good as other headphones at the same price point but i think the sound quality is good, and the battery lasts a while. Marked down because the first unit sent to us was defective, and thats not realky good enough.
customer_reviews.author: thomas

customer_reviews.title: Connection regularly fails
customer_reviews.text: Connection to a single device will regularly fail, with the only solution being to restart the headphones to gain another short period of listening. This happens multiple times on a daily basis and is incredibly frustrating - search Reddit for similar reports. As well as that, the noise cancellation isn't great and the voice used for announcements (such as 'lost connection') is infuriating.
customer_reviews.author: gr0c0

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones, bad noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound, few issues but nothing major. Noise cancelling isn’t the best but not why I got these. Connection to my iPhone SE and XR is perfect and battery life is superb. Even though if I put Boise cancelling on it would most certainly tank. Looks great, are very sturdy and are better than the Sony alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Joe M.

customer_reviews.title: Great, well priced and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Great product , well built and very versatile. I am a frequent traveller and these are amazing when getting on planes, noise cancelling works a treat and very comfortable. After a few hours it does get a bit tight but you can forgive this for the sound quality you get through them. I can get a good 12 hours playback and a little less if I’m using them whilst on the phone. You got to love a good pair of senn’s
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality isn’t great
customer_reviews.text: I returned these, they came without the carry case in the box: inconvenient but not a deal breaker. Sadly the sound quality wasn’t worth the original pre discount price; so not the bargain they appear to be. Ear cups were nice, build quality was good, noise cancelling was on a par with other 80 quid headphones, but I couldn’t live with the tinny, reedy sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Wood

customer_reviews.title: Average Cans for High Quality Pricetag
customer_reviews.text: Entry level headphones. ANC on these is barely noticable and it does nothing to detract from my noisy office environment. Sound quality is average for a set of cans and won't leave anyone partucularly impressed. Controls aren't great either (multifunction button in particular is poorly designed for use). A reasonable price for what they give would be in the £60 ballpark. Overall, dissapointed I didnt go for another set.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Broke after first use
customer_reviews.text: These worked wirelessly once then never switched on again! Thankfully I could return for a full refund but what a shocker, didn’t bother getting a replacement as had no confidence in the product — apparently a common issue with these.
customer_reviews.author: Kirry

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but could have been cheaper :)
customer_reviews.text: Nice pair of headphones, but what I dislike is that built-in women voice command you hear when powered on. It doesn't sound clear enough to know each time whether you switched headphones on or off (there is no constant light being on to show that headphones are powered on).
customer_reviews.author: DAMIAN

customer_reviews.title: Everything about this is OK/Good, so no real complaints for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I use these mostly for my commute on the train. The noise cancelling is good enough, the sound quality is pretty good, great for listening to audible books. I find they pinch my ear after an hour or so. I would recommend. Peter
customer_reviews.author: Peter C

customer_reviews.title: Great for flights
customer_reviews.text: Excellent headphones, good quality and excellent noise cancellation. I wear them when I'm flying and have been able to sound out the noise of the engine while sitting over the wings. Great build quality although the branding on the top is beginning to fade already. Easy to keep clean and comes in a nice little carrying case which doesn't impact much on luggage space.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Coleman

customer_reviews.title: regular clicking noise
customer_reviews.text: for some reason it makes an annoying noise at random intervals when connected to my laptop and not playing any sound, ANC is OK for flights
customer_reviews.author: Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Superb headphones, superb price
customer_reviews.text: The Sennheiser name at a really great price. These headphones are Sennheiser's attempt to make these headphones affordable to people. Paid much less than £100 as they were on offer but the normal price is still truly amazing. Should expect to pay double the price. Never enjoyed listening to music so much - the sound is just awesome as good as any expensive Bose pair and the noise cancellation is simply the best as well. Possibly my best ever purchase on Amazon
customer_reviews.author: A A C AKINTONWA

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality, great comfortability and a great battery life. The sound is very crisp and clearly. Probably the clearest in the mid-high ranges that I’ve heard in headphones. The bass is still good even though it’s not boosted. The noise cancellation is okay, not amazing, but not awful. What I don’t like, however, is beeping after a song/video finishes or the beeping every time you alter the volume, I personally find it distracting. But over all great price - better that Beats Studios!
customer_reviews.author: Dylan B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound and battery life
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Sennheiser and absolutely no regrets so far. The sound is as you would expect is great, wonderful base and mid range. Excellent sound quality when listening on low volume. The noise cancellation is excellent and takes the background buzz of my daily commute away. If I had one little niggle it is they can feel quite tight after wearing for a few hours.
customer_reviews.author: Arty 74

customer_reviews.title: Noise Cancellation Sub par.
customer_reviews.text: I own a pair of HD205's and I can't say the sound quality is noticeably different, the battery life seems the best part. Certainly wouldn't buy these for noise cancellation. It's difficult to know how effective they are becasue they already fully cover your ears, plus they emit a background frequency. They provide some sound dampening but not enough.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Edward Rigler

customer_reviews.title: Brings music back alive!!
customer_reviews.text: I've never owned noise cancelling earphones before so i can give comparisons but i will say these seinheisers have made me fall in love with my music all over again. Real quality product with excellent sound and with regards to battery life ,they haven't gone flat on me yet i just charge the once a week of so. Brilliant bit of kit !!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor for the cost
customer_reviews.text: purchased when on offer at half price £80 however very disapointed with noise cancelling and sound quality for the price £179 you would expect more quality ended up buying Boltune NC headset after reading reviews for £35 which are far supior in all areas and rival the big brands such as these and Bose. vey dissapointed with sennheiser brand.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: Not comfortable as expected from a brand. Noise cancellation is bit funny sometimes it just divert lot of surround inside ear. Bought the bose on ear one without noise cancelling its lot better than this so far.
customer_reviews.author: Am

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones I’ve owened.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to use at work. I work in an office which naturally had a lot of background noise, after using in ear headphones for a few months I thought it was time to change. These are worth every penny, I have used these for a week at work and have not needed to charge them once! The headphones themselves are not too loud but this is not needed due to the noise cancellation. The only downside is they can feel a little heavy after long use but this is to be expected with any over ear headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Nuttall

customer_reviews.title: Good one
customer_reviews.text: Headphones are sturdy with good quality. I have bit of pain for my ears when I started using it since first time for more than 1 hour. I don't know why they are unable to be smooth with their cups on both the ears. I am completely unhappy even though I got it on Black You sale. Not a money's worth for me.
customer_reviews.author: Shakeer Hussain

customer_reviews.title: Too small.
customer_reviews.text: Everything is fine with this headphone except the ear cut size. Maybe my ear too big but for me this is too small and inside on the middle one plastic bit is just push all the time my ear so unfortunately uncomfortable for me that's why I give only 3*.
customer_reviews.author: Snake

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, excellent sound and I love them!
customer_reviews.text: I love these ear phones. Note - I use them at home, not for commuting. But I have used them travelling Ona plane. The sound is crystal clear through the range, the noise cancelling is really good, including on a plane (although this is a first for me so I have only non-noise cancelling headphones to compare to), and I find them very comfortable. One slight niggle - when connected to my iPhone they beep at every track change, which can be annoying.
customer_reviews.author: E Beirne

customer_reviews.title: Quality of a £30ish headphones
customer_reviews.text: Rubbish sound and noise cancellation, does not worth £180 at all, more like £30. Additionally after 30 minutes of use my ears hurt. When using them for calls, people can hear clearly the surrounding noise, literally everything around you that produces sound. Good thing I can return them, the worst spent money...
customer_reviews.author: Steliyan L.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and clear, with ok noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: Bought for half price as part of a treasure truck deal. Very comfortable, sound quality is good and they go quite loud (usually use around 50%). Not entirely convinced with the noise cancelling, the effect isn't that strong, but having said that you can hear music/podcasts clearly on a bus/train. I'm happy with the purchase, but if you're looking for strong noise cancelling you might want to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: A J Smith

customer_reviews.title: Beeps with iPhone
customer_reviews.text: Beeps between every song and button pressed. I've also had connection issues 3 months later. It seems to drop connection when walking with force (i.e. down stairs or downhill). Wouldn't recommend and I would like to return but just outside the return window
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: great NC headphones for the price. my wife use them when she plays electric piano.
customer_reviews.author: gedas

customer_reviews.title: "DIsconnected": I got it after 10th time!!
customer_reviews.text: If you use the headphones with several devices and one of them get disconnected, this silly device will endlessly repeat "Disconnected", no matter what every 20 seconds. the only way to stop it is to switch off the headphone, wait a few second, and start it again. this is SO annoying, and such a design flaw! Cherry on the cake: it's not compatible with WIndows 7.
customer_reviews.author: Miles

customer_reviews.title: Recommended Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love my pair, can't last a day at work without them. They're very good at cancelling out constant background noise such as people talking in a coffee shop or office, or construction work outside your house. One of the ear-cups did rip and eventually open up, revealing the cushioning, although I suspect that it had gotten caught on something while I was taking them out of their protective case. Plenty of replacements availabl, so no big deal. Sound quality is amazing. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Mark Vella

customer_reviews.title: Pefect headphones for the cost
customer_reviews.text: After a few weeks of heavy usage can say I love these headphones. The battery life is great and the NFC pairing makes them super easy to use with any phone with the capability. Noise cancellation isn't the best but is very solid in any indoor setting. The only mark off is the cable type is a 1.5mm from the headphones to 3.5mm, with its own locking system. Cable replacement isn't as easy if you are using them wired and want a longer reach.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Sound is superb, slightly uncomfortable after 2hours
customer_reviews.text: Top quality sound over Bluetooth and cable. I can't wear them for more than a couple of hours at work, which I could with my much more expensive AKGs. But that may be the shape of my head!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat Sennheiser
customer_reviews.text: I use these headphones all the time, battery life is brilliant. The noise cancelling is great and doesn’t effect the sound quality. Used them for the first time in the gym and they were comfortable, no pain of wires and amazing sound quality. I was rowing beside two people and I could only hear my music. I love these headphones
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not sure about the noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: These are really nice headphones, they’re comfortable and the sound is really good. My only real complaint is the noise cancelling, when you turn it on or off a purple light flashes but you can’t tell if it’s on by looking. I have a cheaper pair of Kitsound for the gym that have a switch and you can hear a change in sound when it’s on. I haven’t tried them on a plane yet but I’m not convinced by the noise cancelling.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent but cups can get sweaty
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my trip to Australia - they are excellent, I just cant fathom out how to pause/stop songs using the headset. One point to note is that the ear cups can get "sweaty".
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, comfortable and does the job too well! (kids cannot hear me calling them!!)
customer_reviews.text: Excellent customer service, assisted through Amazon to get a replacement after one of the headsets suddenly stopped working, 6 months after receiving it as a Christmas present. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Gill

product_meta.title: Sennheiser HD 4.50 Bluetooth Wireless Headphones with Active Noise Cancellation, Black and Silver(HD 4.50 BTNC)
product_meta.description: Style:4.50 BTNCThe HD 4.50 BT NC is a wireless headset employing Bluetooth 4.0, aptX and NoiseGard active noise cancelling technologies to deliver exceptional wireless Hi Fi sound. It features NFC for simple pairing of compatible devices. This New headset offers ease of use and convenience Thanks to intuitive ear cup mounted controls for changing tracks and for making calls via the integrated microphone. Wearing comfort is assured by their ergonomically designed ear pads. The HD 4.50 BT NC has excellent battery life, letting listeners enjoy wireless sound with active noise cancellation for up to 19 hours. A battery free listening mode is also possible via a supplied detachable cable. Pick up pattern dual omnidirectional microphones.
feature_bullets: Bluetooth 4.0 and aptX technologies to deliver exceptional wireless sound quality..Connectivity Technology: Wireless
NoiseGard active noise cancellation to reduce ambient noise levels improving the listening experience
Intuitive ear cup mounted controls for changing tracks and for making calls via the integrated microphone. Frequency response (Microphone) : 100 10,000 Hz
Up to 19 hour battery life with Bluetooth and NoiseGard activated and is supplied with connecting cable for battery free listening
2 year warranty when purchased from an authorized Sennheiser dealer

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars5,739 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
